content: During the pipeline, when do we usually get leave. My family keeps asking me when they'll get to see me again, and im trying to be able to give them a good answer.
reply: During the pipeline, when do we usually get leave. My family keeps asking me when they'll get to see me again, and im trying to be able to give them a good answer.
title: Air Force Pararescue

content: Depends on how far away you are... If you are within short driving distance, you might get home on weekend passes towards end of training... If you are widely separated, you may be giving a week or two of " in-route" leave at the end of training which you can go home on... You must remember, leave is earned before it is granted, so you have to put in X amount of time before Y days of leave can be taken. You earn about 3 days of leave per month, I believe, to a total of 30 days a year. How much have you earned??? Wandering and Wondering
reply: Depends on how far away you are... If you are within short driving distance, you might get home on weekend passes towards end of training... content: I due know its 2.5 days per month. You will have to finish up school first. The school house does not want you leaving during the course. My friends kid just did it.
reply: I due know its 2.5 days per month. You will have to finish up school first. The school house does not want you leaving during the course. My friends kid just did it.
title: Air Force Pararescue

content: Our granddaughter who graduated from AF BMT will not get any leave prior to completing her 13 weeks at 4N0, 13 weeks, school and may not get any until she completes her clinicals whereever that may be. That would make it 29 weeks without a leave. After that the she might be give 10 - 14 days. Depending on what the AF has planned for her. It is truly a time when the needs of the service comes first. Wishing you the very best. Hang around here and get to know us and let us get to know you. Please keep us posted. OAL God and the soldier, All men adore, In time of trouble, And no more; For when war is over, And all things righted, God is neglected - The old soldier slighted. Founding Member Original DVG & Proud Member, Rupterd Duck/Derelict Veterans

content: You just have to be patient, it'll work out! The military is slow to come around on somethings, I think your situation is one of them! You'll be ok! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
